meanings.definition: To convert or adapt to the use of transistors.
meanings.sent1: I will transistorise this old radio to make it work with modern technology.
meanings.sent2: The technician will transistorise the circuit board for better performance.
meanings.sent3: Why did the robot want to transistorise its brain with tiny electronic components?
meanings.sent4: She managed to transistorise her outdated computer into a high-tech machine.
meanings.sent5: The inventor's goal was to transistorise the entire city with innovative devices.

meanings.sent1: The engineer will transistorise the new device to enhance its functionality.
meanings.sent2: It is essential to transistorise the amplifier for improved sound quality.
meanings.sent3: The aliens decided to transistorise their spaceship with advanced technology.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to transistorise her mind, filling it with new ideas.
meanings.sent5: The magician's wand appeared to transistorise objects into something magical.
